modules.description: This module runs mutation tests on student test suites by comparing their behavior against intentionally broken implementations. It supports functions with 1 to 4 arguments, using student-defined tests stored in variables like `foo_tests`, and generates reports indicating whether the tests successfully detect the faulty behavior. It includes functions to run individual tests against mutants, grade test suites based on their ability to expose mutants, and check if a student passed mutation testing.

This module runs mutation tests on student test suites by comparing their behavior against broken implementations. It supports functions with one to four arguments, using structural equality or a custom comparison function to check outputs. It generates reports indicating whether student tests successfully expose mutants, with optional checks on the student's own solution.

This module runs mutation tests on student test suites by comparing their behavior against intentionally broken implementations. It supports functions with 1 to 4 arguments, using structural equality or a custom comparison function, and generates reports indicating whether the tests successfully detect the faulty behavior. Concrete use cases include grading test suites based on their ability to expose mutants and determining whether a student passed mutation testing based on the generated report.
